module_summaries.summary:
Line 1: Users can log in using email/username and password.
Line 2: Displays login form with validation errors if any.

Line 1: Users can register by filling out a detailed form.
Line 2: Displays registration fields with validation feedback.

Line 1: Users can view an overview of their accounts.
Line 2: Displays account details like balance and status.

Line 1: Users can open a new account by selecting options.
Line 2: Displays account types and deposit requirements.

Line 1: Users can transfer funds between accounts.
Line 2: Displays transfer form with account and amount fields.

Line 1: Users can pay bills to specified payees.
Line 2: Displays bill payment form with validation checks.

Line 1: Users can apply for a loan by selecting loan type.
Line 2: Displays loan options and required fields.

Line 1: Users can update their contact information.
Line 2: Displays current contact details for editing.

Line 1: Users can manage card settings and requests.
Line 2: Displays card options and control settings.

Line 1: Users can manage investments and trade funds.
Line 2: Displays portfolio snapshot and trade form.

Line 1: Users can generate account statements.
Line 2: Displays statement options and preferences.

Line 1: Users can change their account password.
Line 2: Displays password change form with validation.

Line 1: Users can send messages or schedule callbacks.
Line 2: Displays communication forms with feedback.

Line 1: Users can log out of their account.
Line 2: Redirects to login page after session ends.

test_cases.title: Successful login with valid email and password
steps: Enter a valid email address in the Email/Username input field
Enter a valid password in the Password input field
test_cases.expected_result: Signed in successfully and redirects to Accounts Overview

test_cases.title: Successful login with valid username and password
steps: Enter a valid username in the Email/Username input field
Enter a valid password in the Password input field
test_cases.expected_result: Signed in successfully and redirects to Accounts Overview

test_cases.title: Verify Register link is present
steps: Check if the Register link is present on the page
test_cases.expected_result: Register link is present

test_cases.title: Verify Forgot Password? link is present
steps: Check if the Forgot Password? link is present on the page
test_cases.expected_result: Forgot Password? link is present

test_cases.title: Successful account registration with all valid inputs
steps: Enter valid ZIP Code in 5 digits format
Enter valid phone number in (123) 456-7890 format
Enter valid Social Security Number in 123-45-6789 format
Enter valid username in email format
Enter valid password with at least 8 characters
test_cases.expected_result: Account created successfully — please sign in

test_cases.title: ZIP Code in 5+4 format
steps: Enter valid ZIP Code in 5+4 format
Enter valid phone number in (123) 456-7890 format
Enter valid Social Security Number in 123-45-6789 format
Enter valid username in email format
Enter valid password with at least 8 characters
test_cases.expected_result: Account created successfully — please sign in

test_cases.title: Verify welcome message displays user's name
steps: Check the welcome message at the top of the dashboard
test_cases.expected_result: Welcome message displays the logged-in user's name

test_cases.title: Verify all accounts are displayed for the user
steps: Check the accounts table for all user accounts
test_cases.expected_result: All accounts belonging to the user are displayed in the table

test_cases.title: Verify account numbers are masked except last 4 digits
test_cases.preconditions: Accounts are displayed in the table
steps: Check the account number column in the accounts table
test_cases.expected_result: Account numbers are masked, showing only the last 4 digits

test_cases.title: Verify accounts are ordered by creation date
steps: Check the order of accounts in the table by open date
test_cases.expected_result: Accounts are ordered by creation date, earliest first

test_cases.title: Verify current balance is displayed for each account
test_cases.preconditions: Accounts are displayed in the table
steps: Check the current balance column in the accounts table
test_cases.expected_result: Current balance is displayed for each account

test_cases.title: Verify total balance is displayed in the footer
steps: Check the footer of the dashboard for total balance
test_cases.expected_result: Total balance of all accounts is displayed in the footer

test_cases.title: Verify account status shows as active
test_cases.preconditions: Accounts are displayed in the table
steps: Check the account status column in the accounts table
test_cases.expected_result: Account status shows as 'Active' with a badge

test_cases.title: Open Checking Account with valid deposit and funding source
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Open New Account page
steps: Enter a valid deposit amount greater than or equal to $25
Select a funding source account with sufficient balance
test_cases.expected_result: 'Account opened successfully!' message is displayed and user is redirected to accounts overview

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the new checking account appears in the accounts overview
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify all accounts are displayed for the user
post_verifications.execution_note: Use this test to check the accounts table after account creation to confirm the new checking account is listed.

test_cases.title: Open Savings Account with valid deposit and funding source
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Open New Account page
steps: Enter a valid deposit amount greater than or equal to $100
Select a funding source account with sufficient balance
test_cases.expected_result: 'Account opened successfully!' message is displayed and user is redirected to accounts overview

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the new savings account appears in the accounts overview
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify all accounts are displayed for the user
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be adapted to verify the presence of the new savings account by checking if it appears in the accounts table.
post_verifications.reason: The test operates on the correct module and checks for all user accounts, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a newly created savings account.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the new savings account is specifically listed in the accounts table after creation.

coverage_gaps: The test operates on the correct module and checks for all user accounts, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a newly created savings account.

test_cases.title: Successful internal transfer between different accounts
test_cases.preconditions: User has sufficient funds in the source account
steps: Enter a valid positive amount in the Transfer Amount field
Select a different account from the Source Account dropdown
Select a different account from the Destination Account dropdown
test_cases.expected_result: Transfer completed successfully with a transaction ID

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the source account balance decreased by the transferred amount
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify current balance is displayed for each account
post_verifications.execution_note: Use this test to observe and record the current balance of the source account before and after the transfer.
post_verifications.before_action: Record the source account balance before the transfer
post_verifications.after_action: Compare the source account balance and confirm it decreased by the transfer amount

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the destination account balance increased by the transferred amount
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify current balance is displayed for each account
post_verifications.execution_note: Use this test to display the current balance for the destination account before and after the transfer. The execution strategy will handle the comparison.
post_verifications.before_action: Record the destination account balance before the transfer
post_verifications.after_action: Compare the destination account balance and confirm it increased by the transfer amount

test_cases.title: Successful external transfer with matching account numbers
test_cases.preconditions: User has sufficient funds in the source account
steps: Enter a valid positive amount in the Transfer Amount field
Select an account from the Source Account dropdown
Enter a valid account number in the Account Number input
Re-enter the same account number in the Confirm Account Number input
test_cases.expected_result: Transfer completed successfully with a transaction ID

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the source account balance decreased by the transferred amount
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify current balance is displayed for each account
post_verifications.execution_note: Use this test to display the current balance of the source account before and after the fund transfer.
post_verifications.before_action: Record the source account balance before the transfer
post_verifications.after_action: Compare the source account balance and confirm it decreased by the transfer amount

test_cases.title: Verify balance update after successful transfer
test_cases.preconditions: User has sufficient funds in the source account
steps: Enter a valid positive amount in the Transfer Amount field
Select a different account from the Source Account dropdown
Select a different account from the Destination Account dropdown
Check the balance of the source account
test_cases.expected_result: Balance of the source account is reduced by the transfer amount

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the source account balance decreased by the transferred amount
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify current balance is displayed for each account
post_verifications.execution_note: Use this test to display the current balance of the source account before and after the transfer.
post_verifications.before_action: Record the source account balance before the transfer
post_verifications.after_action: Compare the source account balance and confirm it decreased by the transfer amount

test_cases.title: Successful bill payment with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has sufficient balance
steps: Enter a valid Payee Account Number
Re-enter the same Payee Account Number in Confirm Account Number
Enter a positive numeric Payment Amount
Select a Source Account with sufficient balance
test_cases.expected_result: Payment submitted successfully with reference code and balances updated

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the source account balance decreased by the bill payment amount
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify current balance is displayed for each account
post_verifications.execution_note: Use this test to display the current balance of each account before and after the bill payment.
post_verifications.before_action: Record the source account balance before the bill payment
post_verifications.after_action: Compare the source account balance and confirm it decreased by the bill payment amount

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the bill payment transaction appears in the transaction history
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases access or display transaction history data, which is required to confirm the presence of a bill payment transaction.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually navigate to the Accounts Overview module and check the transaction history to confirm the bill payment entry is recorded.

coverage_gaps: None of the test cases access or display transaction history data, which is required to confirm the presence of a bill payment transaction.

test_cases.title: Apply for a loan with valid inputs
steps: Enter a valid loan amount within the specified range
Enter a valid down payment less than the loan amount
Select a valid collateral account with sufficient funds
test_cases.expected_result: Loan approved and created successfully!

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the loan appears in the user's loan overview
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify all accounts are displayed for the user
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be used to check if all accounts are displayed, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a new loan.
post_verifications.reason: The test operates on the correct module and checks for accounts, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a new loan.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify the presence of the new loan in the accounts table after running this test.

coverage_gaps: The test operates on the correct module and checks for accounts, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a new loan.

test_cases.title: Update profile with valid data
test_cases.preconditions: Form is pre-populated with current user data
test_cases.expected_result: Profile updated successfully

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the updated contact information is displayed correctly
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases confirm that the updated contact information is displayed correctly after the update action.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check that the updated contact information matches the expected data in the Update Contact Info module.

coverage_gaps: None of the test cases confirm that the updated contact information is displayed correctly after the update action.

test_cases.title: Form pre-populated with current user data
steps: Verify first name field is pre-populated
Verify last name field is pre-populated
Verify street address field is pre-populated
Verify ZIP code field is pre-populated
Verify phone number field is pre-populated
test_cases.expected_result: All fields are pre-populated with current user data

test_cases.title: Submit card request with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Request New Card page
steps: Select a card type from the Card Type selection
Select an account from the Account to Link dropdown
Enter a complete shipping address in the Shipping Address input
test_cases.expected_result: Card request submitted successfully with tracking ID

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the card request appears in the card management section with a tracking ID
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Submit card request with maximum length shipping address
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be used to verify that a card request is submitted successfully with a tracking ID, which confirms the expected outcome.

test_cases.title: Update card controls with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Manage Cards page with an existing card selected
steps: Select an existing card from the dropdown
Enter a valid new spending limit
test_cases.expected_result: Card controls updated successfully

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the card controls reflect the updated settings
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases confirm that card controls reflect updated settings. They either focus on displaying available card types or testing boundary conditions for spending limits without verifying updated settings.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the card controls reflect the updated settings by checking the card control interface after making changes.

coverage_gaps: None of the test cases confirm that card controls reflect updated settings. They either focus on displaying available card types or testing boundary conditions for spending limits without verifying updated settings.

test_cases.title: Verify card type selection displays available card types
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Request New Card page
steps: Click on the Card Type selection
test_cases.expected_result: Available card types are displayed in the dropdown

test_cases.title: Verify account to link dropdown displays available accounts
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Request New Card page
steps: Click on the Account to Link dropdown
test_cases.expected_result: Available accounts are displayed in the dropdown

test_cases.title: Execute trade successfully with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Execute Trade page
steps: Enter a valid quantity greater than 0
test_cases.expected_result: Trade executed successfully with an order ID displayed

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the trade order ID is displayed after execution
post_verifications.reason: None of the candidate test cases access or display the order ID, which is necessary to confirm the expected outcome for the after_only strategy.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the Investments module to confirm that the order ID is displayed after executing a trade.

coverage_gaps: None of the candidate test cases access or display the order ID, which is necessary to confirm the expected outcome for the after_only strategy.

test_cases.title: Create recurring investment plan successfully with valid inputs
steps: Enter a valid contribution amount meeting the minimum requirement
Enter a valid future start date
Select a valid funding account with adequate balance
test_cases.expected_result: Plan created successfully

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the recurring investment plan is listed in the investment plans
post_verifications.reason: None of the candidate test cases access or display the list of investment plans, which is necessary to confirm the new recurring investment plan appears.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the list of investment plans to verify the new recurring investment plan is listed.

coverage_gaps: None of the candidate test cases access or display the list of investment plans, which is necessary to confirm the new recurring investment plan appears.

test_cases.title: Verify funding/destination account dropdown displays correctly
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Execute Trade page
test_cases.expected_result: Dropdown displays all available accounts correctly

test_cases.title: Generate statement for a selected month and year
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the account statements page
steps: Select a valid account from the Account dropdown
Select a specific month and year from the Statement Period
Click on the Generate Statement button
test_cases.expected_result: Statement generated successfully

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the statement for the selected month and year is generated
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Generate statement for a custom date range
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be adapted to verify the generation of a statement for a specific month and year by adjusting the date range to match the selected period.
post_verifications.reason: The test operates on the correct module and involves generating a statement, but it does not explicitly confirm the availability of a statement for a specific month and year.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: After executing the test, manually verify that the statement for the selected month and year is listed in the generated statements.

coverage_gaps: The test operates on the correct module and involves generating a statement, but it does not explicitly confirm the availability of a statement for a specific month and year.

test_cases.title: Generate statement for a custom date range
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the account statements page
steps: Select a valid account from the Account dropdown
Select a valid start date and end date from the Statement Period
Click on the Generate Statement button
test_cases.expected_result: Statement generated successfully

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the statement for the custom date range is generated
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Generate statement with same start and end date
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be adapted to verify statement generation for a custom date range by modifying the date selection step.
post_verifications.reason: The test operates on the correct module and involves generating a statement, but it specifically tests for the same start and end date, not a custom date range.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the statement for the custom date range is generated by selecting a different start and end date.

coverage_gaps: The test operates on the correct module and involves generating a statement, but it specifically tests for the same start and end date, not a custom date range.

test_cases.title: Opt into paperless statements with valid email
steps: Check the checkbox to opt into paperless statements
Enter a valid email address in the Email Address input
test_cases.expected_result: e-Statement preference updated

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the e-Statement preference is updated to paperless
post_verifications.reason: None of the candidate test cases confirm the expected outcome that the e-Statement preference is set to paperless. They focus on email field validation when opting into paperless statements, not on verifying the preference state itself.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the e-Statement preferences in the Account Statements module to ensure the preference is set to paperless.

coverage_gaps: None of the candidate test cases confirm the expected outcome that the e-Statement preference is set to paperless. They focus on email field validation when opting into paperless statements, not on verifying the preference state itself.

test_cases.title: Verify email field presence when opting into paperless statements
steps: Check the checkbox to opt into paperless statements
test_cases.expected_result: Email Address input is displayed and required

test_cases.title: Change password successfully
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Security Settings page
steps: Enter a new password that meets the strong-password policy
Enter the same new password in the Confirm New Password field
test_cases.expected_result: Password changed successfully.

test_cases.title: Send secure message with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Send Secure Message page
steps: Enter a valid subject in the Subject input
Select a category from the Category dropdown
Enter a valid message in the Message Body
test_cases.expected_result: Message sent successfully with a ticket ID displayed

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the secure message is sent and a ticket ID is displayed
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Send secure message with valid inputs and attachment
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be used to verify the requirement as it confirms that a ticket ID is displayed after sending a secure message.

test_cases.title: Submit callback request successfully with valid inputs
steps: Select a valid reason from the Reason for Call dropdown
Enter a valid date that is at least the next business day in the Preferred Date input
Enter a valid time window in the Preferred Time Window input
Enter a valid phone number in the Phone Number input
test_cases.expected_result: Callback request submitted and email confirmation sent

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the callback request is submitted and email confirmation is sent
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases access or confirm the sending of an email confirmation for a callback request.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the email system or logs to confirm that an email confirmation was sent after the callback request submission.

coverage_gaps: None of the test cases access or confirm the sending of an email confirmation for a callback request.

test_cases.title: Send secure message with valid inputs and attachment
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Send Secure Message page
steps: Enter a valid subject in the Subject input
Select a category from the Category dropdown
Enter a valid message in the Message Body
Attach a valid file using the Attachment input
test_cases.expected_result: Message sent successfully with a ticket ID displayed

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the secure message with attachment is sent and a ticket ID is displayed
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Send secure message with valid inputs
post_verifications.execution_note: This test can be used to verify that a secure message with attachment is sent and a ticket ID is displayed.

test_cases.title: Verify form elements display correctly
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Send Secure Message page
steps: Verify the Subject input is displayed
Verify the Category dropdown is displayed
Verify the Message Body is displayed
Verify the Attachment input is displayed
Verify the Send Message button is displayed
test_cases.expected_result: All form elements are displayed correctly

test_cases.title: Successful logout redirects to login page
test_cases.expected_result: User is redirected to the login page

test_cases.title: Successful logout ends user session
test_cases.expected_result: User session is ended

test_cases.title: Successful logout clears sensitive data
test_cases.expected_result: Sensitive data is cleared

test_cases.title: Accessing protected page after logout redirects to login
steps: Attempt to access a protected page
test_cases.expected_result: User is redirected to the login page

test_cases.title: Email field empty
steps: Leave the Email/Username input field empty
Enter a valid password in the Password input field
test_cases.expected_result: Error message displayed: 'Incorrect email or password. Please try again', clears the password field

test_cases.title: Password field empty
steps: Enter a valid email address in the Email/Username input field
Leave the Password input field empty
test_cases.expected_result: Error message displayed: 'Incorrect email or password. Please try again', clears the password field

test_cases.title: Invalid email format
steps: Enter an invalid email format in the Email/Username input field

test_cases.expected_result: Error message displayed: 'Incorrect email or password. Please try again', clears the password field

test_cases.title: Password less than 8 characters

test_cases.title: Deposit amount below minimum for Savings
test_cases.preconditions: User is on the Open New Account page

coverage_gaps: None of the test cases confirm that card controls reflect updated settings. They either focus on displaying available card types or testing boundary conditions for spending limits without verifying updated settings.
The test operates on the correct module and checks for accounts, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a new loan.
None of the candidate test cases access or display the order ID, which is necessary to confirm the expected outcome for the after_only strategy.
None of the candidate test cases access or display the list of investment plans, which is necessary to confirm the new recurring investment plan appears.
None of the test cases confirm that the updated contact information is displayed correctly after the update action.
The test operates on the correct module and involves generating a statement, but it does not explicitly confirm the availability of a statement for a specific month and year.

None of the candidate test cases confirm the expected outcome that the e-Statement preference is set to paperless. They focus on email field validation when opting into paperless statements, not on verifying the preference state itself.
The test operates on the correct module and involves generating a statement, but it specifically tests for the same start and end date, not a custom date range.
The test operates on the correct module and checks for all user accounts, but it does not specifically confirm the presence of a newly created savings account.
None of the test cases access or display transaction history data, which is required to confirm the presence of a bill payment transaction.
